docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 9 -- The centerpiece of the Soviet Union's cultural program in Uruguay this season has been knocked off the stage for purely capitalistic reasons.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 10 -- The Uruguayan Ambassador here denied today the report that Dr. Velasquez's transfer was related to his speeches about the Dominican crisis.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 10 -- Uruguay decided today to withdraw her representative from the United Nations Security Council as an expression of disapproval of his denunciation of United States policy in the Dominican Republic.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 10 -- Uruguay decided today to withdraw her representative from the United Nations Security Council as an expression of disapproval of his denunciation of United States policy in the Dominican Republic.
docs.abstract: Uruguay to withdraw Amb to UN Velazquez to express disapproval of his strong attack on US in Security Council; charges he obscured Govt wish to stress inter-Amer approach to Dominican problem; Velazquez refuses comment; Uruguayan Amb in US denies removal is linked to Dominican crisis

docs.snippet: At Cape Kennedy early last Monday afternoon, workmen hoisted a giant Titan II booster into position on Pad 19 for the scheduled August launching of Gemini 5. As the rocket was being raised, Gemini 4 was speeding overhead toward splashdown in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: At Cape Kennedy early last Monday afternoon, workmen hoisted a giant Titan II booster into position on Pad 19 for the scheduled August launching of Gemini 5. As the rocket was being raised, Gemini 4 was speeding overhead toward splashdown in the Atlantic after a triumphal 1.6 million mile, 62-orbit journey that had begun four days earlier from the same launching pad.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 12 -- Dr. Washington Beltran, President of Uruguay's National Council, said today that the restoration of financial stability and public confidence in Uruguay was the major Objective of the nine months left for his...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 12 -- Dr. Washington Beltran, President of Uruguay's National Council, said today that the restoration of financial stability and public confidence in Uruguay was the major Objective of the nine months left for his Government.
docs.abstract: Natl Council pres Beltran sees restoration of financial stability and pub confidence as major Govt tasks, int; pledges new econ program

headline.main: URUGUAY LEADER LISTS OBJECTIVES; Beltran Aims for Stability in Last 9 Months in Office

byline.original: By HENRY RAYMONTSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 13 -- Foreign Minister Luis Vidal Zaglio will travel this week to Chile and Peru to coordinate a new approach to the Dominican crisis among the South American governments opposed to the present inter-American policy,...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 13 -- Foreign Minister Luis Vidal Zaglio will travel this week to Chile and Peru to coordinate a new approach to the Dominican crisis among the South American governments opposed to the present inter-American policy, official sources said today.
docs.abstract: Vidal to seek Chilean and Peruvian support for pol solution within OAS framework

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 18 -- In a move directed against the United States, Jordan and France attempted today to obtain a Security Council decision that neither side should cross the cease-fire line in the Dominican Republic.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 18 -- In a move directed against the United States, Jordan and France attempted today to obtain a Security Council decision that neither side should cross the cease-fire line in the Dominican Republic.

headline.main: DOMINICAN STAND BY U.N. IS URGED; Council Asked to Demand Freezing of Truce Lines

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 18 -- It is the miles of white beaches backed by white sand dunes and tall eucalyptus trees on the north bank of the River Plate that have fashioned the pace of Montevideo's leisurely and relaxed life.

headline.main: Uneasiness in Uruguay; Montevideo Longs for Summer's Joys in the Midst of Its Winter of Discontent

byline.original: By HENRY RAYMONTSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 20 -- Amid a grave political and financial crisis, several influential political leaders are making a determined effort to preserve Uruguay as the oldest exponent in Latin America of the two-party system.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 20 -- Amid a grave political and financial crisis, several influential political leaders are making a determined effort to preserve Uruguay as the oldest exponent in Latin America of the two-party system.
docs.abstract: Pol leaders move to heal splits in major parties in effort to preserve 2-party system; many disillusioned with Council Govt; blame majority Blanco party for current natl crisis
